question: Based on the provided evidence, answer the following question: What university did Jens A Schröder attend around 2030?. If the evidence is insufficient to answer the question, return 'INSUFFICIENT_INFORMATION'.

content.source_1:
Here is a potential Wikipedia entry:

Jens A Schröder

Jens A Schröder is a researcher with the ORCID identifier 0000-0002-3949-5253. Education

Schröder attended the University of Bern, a university located in the Swiss capital of Bern, Switzerland. Evidence

According to Schröder's ORCID profile, he has listed the University of Bern as one of his affiliations. [1] Additionally, a search of academic databases such as Scopus and Web of Science reveals numerous publications authored by Schröder with the University of Bern listed as his institutional affiliation. [2][3]

References

[1] ORCID. (n.d.). Jens A Schröder. Retrieved from <https:\/\/orcid.org\/0000-0002-3949-5253>

[2] Scopus. (n.d.). Author search: Schröder, J.A. Retrieved from <https:\/\/www.scopus.com\/authid\/detail.uri?authorId=57194461200>

[3] Web of Science. (n.d.). Author search: Schröder, J.A.
content.source_2: In the year 2032, Vasileios Chatzaras stepped onto the campus of the University of Nottingham, a prestigious Russell Group public research university in Nottingham, England. The air was alive with the hum of innovation and discovery, as students and faculty from all corners of the globe converged to push the boundaries of human knowledge. Vasileios, a bright and ambitious young researcher, had just been accepted into the university's esteemed program, and he was determined to make the most of his time there. Over the next two years, he immersed himself in his studies, delving deep into the latest advancements in his field and collaborating with fellow students and professors to explore new ideas and solutions. As the months passed, Vasileios became an integral part of the university community, attending seminars and workshops, participating in research projects, and engaging in lively debates with his peers. He was particularly drawn to the university's cutting-edge facilities, which provided him with access to state-of-the-art equipment and technology that enabled him to conduct experiments and gather data with unprecedented precision. In 2033, Vasileios's hard work began to pay off. He landed a coveted research internship with a renowned professor, which gave him the opportunity to work on a high-profile project that had the potential to revolutionize his field. The experience was invaluable, and Vasileios's skills and expertise grew exponentially as he worked alongside his mentor to design and implement innovative solutions. As the academic year drew to a close, Vasileios reflected on the incredible journey he had been on. He had grown both personally and professionally, and he was proud of the progress he had made. But he knew that his time at the University of Nottingham was far from over. He had another year to go, and he was eager to continue pushing the boundaries of what was possible. In 2034, Vasileios's final year at the university, he threw himself into his research with renewed passion and energy. He worked tirelessly to complete his thesis, pouring over data and conducting experiments with a level of precision and dedication that impressed even his most seasoned professors. As the summer drew to a close, Vasileios stood on the threshold of a new chapter in his life. He had accomplished everything he had set out to do, and more. He had forged lasting connections with his peers and mentors, and he had gained a wealth of knowledge and experience that would serve him well in the years to come.
